definitions: impressively great in size, extent, or degree that inspires awe
relating to or characteristic of heroic poems and their grand narrative style
examples: The storm brought epic amounts of snow to the region
Their cross-country journey was an epic adventure of discovery
Homer's epic poetry tells stories of ancient Greek heroes
The movie follows an epic narrative spanning three generations

definitions: devoted to sensual enjoyment, especially from fine food and drink
relating to Greek philosopher Epicurus or his teachings about happiness through moderation
examples: The restaurant offers epicurean delights from around the world
His epicurean tastes led him to collect rare wines
Ancient epicurean philosophy emphasized simple pleasures over excess
The epicurean school taught that happiness comes from modest living

definitions: affecting or tending to affect a disproportionately large number of individuals within a population
examples: Obesity has reached epidemic proportions in many developed countries
The flu outbreak quickly became epidemic throughout the school district

definitions: relating to the branch of medicine dealing with the incidence, distribution, and control of diseases
examples: The epidemiological study tracked disease patterns across different populations
Scientists used epidemiological data to predict the spread of infection

definitions: relating to or affected by the neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures
examples: The patient experienced epileptic seizures twice a month
New epileptic medications have fewer side effects than older treatments

definitions: relating to or governed by bishops within the Christian church hierarchy
examples: The episcopal church follows a traditional hierarchical structure
Episcopal authority extends throughout the diocese under their leadership

definitions: occurring occasionally and at irregular intervals rather than continuously
containing or consisting of separate episodes or distinct narrative segments
examples: His episodic migraines would appear without warning every few months
The patient showed episodic memory loss after the accident
The novel uses an episodic structure with interconnected short stories
Television series often employ episodic storytelling to engage viewers weekly

definitions: relating to knowledge or the degree of its validation in philosophical and scientific contexts
examples: The research addresses epistemic questions about how we know things
Different cultures have varying epistemic frameworks for understanding reality

definitions: written in the form of letters or suitable to correspondence and letter writing
examples: The epistolary novel told its story through characters' exchanged letters
Her epistolary style made the historical narrative feel more personal

definitions: giving one's name to something or named after a particular person or thing
examples: The band released their eponymous debut album last year
Shakespeare's eponymous heroes like Hamlet carry the play's title

definitions: relating to or located at the earth's equator or celestial equator regions
examples: Equatorial rainforests maintain consistent temperatures throughout the year
The satellite follows an equatorial orbit around the planet

definitions: relating to horse riding or horseback riders and their skills or equipment
examples: The equestrian center offers riding lessons for all skill levels
Olympic equestrian events test both horse and rider abilities

definitions: at equal distances from two or more points or places in space
examples: The towns are equidistant from the state capital
Place the posts equidistant from each other along the fence

definitions: having all sides of equal length, especially referring to triangles in geometry
examples: An equilateral triangle has three sides of identical length
The designer created an equilateral pyramid for the monument

definitions: relating to or affecting horses or other members of the horse family
examples: The veterinarian specializes in equine medicine and surgery
Equine therapy helps children with developmental disabilities

definitions: supplied with necessary items, tools, or provisions for a particular purpose
examples: The kitchen came fully equipped with modern appliances
Rescue teams were equipped with specialized gear for mountain terrain

definitions: fair and impartial in treatment or judgment without favoritism or bias
examples: The judge sought an equitable solution for both parties
An equitable distribution of resources benefits the entire community

definitions: open to more than one interpretation or having doubtful or uncertain nature
examples: His equivocal response left everyone confused about his position
The test results were equivocal and required further investigation

definitions: in a vertical or upright position rather than bent or lying down
rigidly straight or stiff in posture or bodily position
examples: The soldiers stood erect during the ceremony
Ancient peoples learned to walk erect millions of years ago
His erect posture conveyed confidence and authority
The dog's ears became erect when it heard a noise

definitions: capable of becoming rigid or upright, especially referring to body tissues or organs
examples: Erectile tissue responds to increased blood flow
Some animals have erectile crests that display during mating

definitions: designed for efficiency and comfort in the working environment to reduce strain
examples: The ergonomic chair supports proper posture during long work hours
Ergonomic keyboards help prevent repetitive strain injuries

definitions: gradually worn away by natural forces like wind, water, or weather over time
examples: The eroded cliffs showed layers of ancient rock formations
Years of neglect left the building's foundation severely eroded

definitions: tending to erode or capable of causing gradual destruction or wearing away
examples: Acid rain has erosive effects on limestone buildings
The river's erosive power carved deep canyons over millennia

definitions: relating to or tending to arouse sexual desire or excitement in nature
examples: The museum houses ancient erotic art from various cultures
Romance novels often contain erotic passages between characters

definitions: straying from the proper course or standards of behavior or judgment
deviating from the accepted or correct path, often implying wrongdoing
examples: An errant golf ball broke the clubhouse window
The knight set out to find his errant squire
The company fired several errant employees for violating policies
His errant behavior disappointed his parents and teachers

definitions: not even or regular in pattern or movement; unpredictable and inconsistent
examples: His erratic driving made other motorists nervous
The patient's erratic heartbeat concerned the medical team

definitions: wrong or incorrect based on false information or faulty reasoning
examples: The newspaper printed an erroneous report about the accident
Erroneous assumptions led to the project's complete failure

definitions: made or used as a substitute, typically an inferior one, for something else
examples: During wartime, people drank ersatz coffee made from chicory
The movie used ersatz snow made from soap flakes

definitions: former or previous but not now; belonging to an earlier time
examples: His erstwhile business partner now runs a competing company
The erstwhile allies became bitter enemies after the war

definitions: having or showing great knowledge or learning from extensive reading and study
examples: The professor's erudite lectures drew students from across campus
Her erudite analysis of the text revealed hidden meanings

definitions: characterized by or producing eruption; bursting forth or breaking out suddenly
examples: The region's eruptive volcanoes pose constant danger to residents
His eruptive temper made him difficult to work with

definitions: having broken free from confinement or control to achieve freedom
examples: Police searched for the escaped prisoner throughout the night
The escaped zoo animals were safely recaptured within hours

definitions: intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people with specialized knowledge
examples: The professor's esoteric references confused most undergraduate students
Ancient texts contain esoteric wisdom known only to initiates

definitions: particularly great or notable; exceptional to a degree worthy of special mention
examples: She took especial care with the antique vase
The ceremony holds especial significance for the community

definitions: having been in existence for a long time and therefore recognized and accepted
having achieved permanent acceptance or recognition as a standard or authority
examples: The established business had served the community for decades
They followed established procedures for handling complaints
Einstein challenged established theories about space and time
The established facts of the case left no doubt

definitions: held in great respect and admiration by others for achievements or qualities
examples: The esteemed scientist received numerous awards for her research
He comes from an esteemed family of musicians and composers

definitions: concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty in art and nature
examples: The building's esthetic appeal draws tourists from around the world
She made esthetic choices that enhanced the room's ambiance

definitions: no longer close or affectionate to someone; alienated from former relationships
examples: The estranged couple finally agreed to divorce proceedings
He remained estranged from his family for twenty years

definitions: relating to or found in an estuary where river meets sea water
examples: Estuarine ecosystems support diverse marine and freshwater species
The estuarine environment changes with each tide cycle

definitions: cut or carved into a surface, or deeply impressed as if engraved
examples: The artist's name was etched into the corner of the glass
Years of worry had etched deep lines on her face

definitions: extremely delicate and light in a way that seems not of this world
examples: The dancer moved with ethereal grace across the stage
Morning mist gave the landscape an ethereal quality

definitions: relating to the scientific description of peoples and cultures with their customs and differences
examples: The ethnographic study documented traditional wedding ceremonies
Museums display ethnographic artifacts from indigenous peoples worldwide

definitions: relating to the study of the origin and historical development of words
examples: The dictionary provides detailed etymological information for each entry
His etymological research traced the word back to ancient Greek

definitions: relating to the ancient Greek mathematician Euclid or his system of geometry
examples: Students learn euclidean geometry principles in high school mathematics
The euclidean distance between two points follows Pythagoras' theorem

definitions: characterized by or feeling intense excitement and happiness beyond normal pleasure
examples: The team was euphoric after winning the championship game
The medication can cause euphoric feelings in some patients

definitions: relating to or based on assessment of value, quality, or importance
examples: The committee took an evaluative approach to reviewing applications
Teachers use evaluative rubrics to grade student presentations fairly

definitions: soon passing out of sight, memory, or existence; quickly fading or disappearing
examples: The evanescent morning dew disappeared as the sun rose
Youth's evanescent beauty inspired countless poems throughout history

definitions: zealously advocating or supporting a particular cause, originally relating to gospel teaching
examples: The evangelical preacher attracted large crowds to revival meetings
She approached environmental protection with evangelical fervor

definitions: seeking to convert others to one's beliefs through zealous preaching or advocacy
examples: The church launched an evangelistic campaign in urban areas
His evangelistic approach to veganism annoyed his dinner companions

definitions: having been converted from liquid into vapor and dispersed into air
examples: The puddles had evaporated completely by noon
All their savings evaporated during the economic crisis
